name: q1
title: What are the two main components required for S3 cross-account access?
choices: Access Control Lists (ACLs) and Resource-based policies

name: q2
title: Which AWS service evaluation logic determines the final access decision?
choices: Union of all applicable policies (allow if any policy allows)
Intersection of all policies (allow only if all policies allow)
The most restrictive policy takes precedence
The first policy found takes precedence
correctAnswer: Union of all applicable policies (allow if any policy allows)

name: q3
title: What is the purpose of the 'Principal' element in an S3 bucket policy?
choices: To specify which AWS accounts, users, or roles can access the bucket
To define the actions that can be performed
To specify the resources being accessed
correctAnswer: To specify which AWS accounts, users, or roles can access the bucket

name: q4
title: Which S3 action is required for listing objects in a bucket?

name: q5
title: What is the difference between s3:ListBucket and s3:GetObject permissions?
choices: ListBucket shows what objects exist, GetObject reads object content
ListBucket is for folders, GetObject is for files
ListBucket requires admin access, GetObject doesn't
correctAnswer: ListBucket shows what objects exist, GetObject reads object content

name: q6
title: In S3 cross-account access, what does the condition 's3:ExistingObjectTag' check?
choices: Whether an object has specific tags before allowing access
Whether the user has existing permissions
Whether the object was previously accessed
correctAnswer: Whether an object has specific tags before allowing access

name: q7
title: What is the maximum size of an S3 bucket policy document?

name: q8
title: Which IAM policy element is used to grant temporary cross-account access?

name: q9
title: What is required in the trust policy of a cross-account IAM role?
choices: The AWS account ID or ARN that can assume the role
The VPC ID where the role will be used
The region where the role will be active
correctAnswer: The AWS account ID or ARN that can assume the role

name: q10
title: For SQS cross-account access, which policy type is attached to the queue?

name: q11
title: Which SQS action allows sending messages to a queue from another account?

name: q12
title: What SQS action is required for receiving messages from a cross-account queue?

name: q13
title: Which condition key can restrict SQS access based on the source IP address?

name: q14
title: What is the purpose of 'sqs:DeleteMessage' permission?
choices: To remove messages from the queue after processing
To clear all messages from the queue
correctAnswer: To remove messages from the queue after processing

name: q15
title: In AWS policy language, what does the 'StringEquals' condition operator do?
choices: Checks if a string contains a substring

name: q16
title: What is the purpose of the 'aws:userid' condition key?
choices: To match against the unique identifier of the AWS principal
To check the user's display name
To verify the user's email address
To validate the user's login time
correctAnswer: To match against the unique identifier of the AWS principal

name: q17
title: Which S3 condition key restricts access based on the encryption method used?

name: q18
title: What does the 'aws:SecureTransport' condition key enforce?
choices: That data must be encrypted at rest
That requests come from a VPC

name: q19
title: In S3 bucket policies, what does the 'Resource' element specify?
choices: The S3 bucket and object ARNs that the policy applies to
The AWS account that owns the resources
The region where the resources are located
The encryption keys used for the resources
correctAnswer: The S3 bucket and object ARNs that the policy applies to

name: q20
title: What is the correct ARN format for an S3 object?

name: q21
title: Which SQS condition key can limit access to specific queue attributes?

name: q22
title: What is the effect of setting 'Effect': 'Deny' in a policy statement?
choices: Explicitly denies access regardless of other allow statements
Allows access only if other conditions are met
Has no effect on the final access decision
Only applies to the current AWS account
correctAnswer: Explicitly denies access regardless of other allow statements

name: q23
title: Which AWS service helps analyze effective permissions across accounts?

name: q24
title: What is the purpose of External ID in cross-account role assumption?
choices: To prevent the confused deputy problem by adding an additional authentication factor
To identify the external AWS account
To specify the role session name
To set the maximum session duration
correctAnswer: To prevent the confused deputy problem by adding an additional authentication factor

name: q25
title: In S3, what permission is needed to get the bucket's location?

name: q26
title: Which condition operator allows checking if a value exists in a list?

name: q27
title: What does the 'aws:RequestedRegion' condition key restrict?
choices: The AWS region where the API call is made
The region where the user is located
The region where resources must be created
The home region of the AWS account
correctAnswer: The AWS region where the API call is made

name: q28
title: For SQS dead letter queues, which permission allows configuring the redrive policy?

name: q29
title: What is the maximum number of access control list (ACL) grants for an S3 object?

name: q30
title: Which S3 condition key restricts uploads based on object metadata?

name: q31
title: What happens when both an explicit Allow and Deny exist for the same action?
choices: Access is granted based on the account owner

name: q32
title: Which SQS permission is required to get queue attributes like message count?

name: q33
title: What is the purpose of the 'aws:MultiFactorAuthPresent' condition?
choices: To require multi-factor authentication for access
To check if the user has multiple AWS accounts
To ensure the request comes from multiple sources
correctAnswer: To require multi-factor authentication for access

name: q34
title: Which S3 action allows uploading objects using multipart upload?

name: q35
title: What is the correct way to specify all objects in an S3 bucket in a policy?

name: q36
title: Which condition key restricts SQS access based on message attributes?

name: q37
title: What is the difference between resource-based and identity-based policies?
choices: Resource-based policies are attached to resources, identity-based to users/roles
They are the same type of policy
Identity-based policies only work within the same account
correctAnswer: Resource-based policies are attached to resources, identity-based to users/roles

name: q38
title: Which AWS service provides real-time monitoring of API calls for security analysis?

name: q39
title: What is the purpose of the 'aws:TokenIssueTime' condition key?
choices: To restrict access based on when temporary credentials were issued
correctAnswer: To restrict access based on when temporary credentials were issued

name: q40
title: For S3 cross-account replication, which permission is required on the source bucket?

name: q41
title: Which SQS condition can restrict access based on the queue URL?

name: q42
title: What is the maximum duration for temporary credentials obtained via AssumeRole?

name: q43
title: Which S3 condition key restricts access based on the object's storage class?

name: q44
title: What does the 'NotPrincipal' element do in a policy statement?
choices: Specifies principals that are explicitly excluded from the policy
correctAnswer: Specifies principals that are explicitly excluded from the policy

name: q45
title: For SQS FIFO queues, which additional permission might be needed for message deduplication?

name: q46
title: What is the purpose of the 'DateGreaterThan' condition operator?
choices: To restrict access based on date/time comparisons
correctAnswer: To restrict access based on date/time comparisons

name: q47
title: Which AWS CLI command can simulate policy evaluation?

name: q48
title: What is the effect of using wildcard (*) in the Principal element?
choices: Allows access from any AWS account or user
Allows access only from the current account
Creates an error in the policy
Allows access from any IP address
correctAnswer: Allows access from any AWS account or user

name: q49
title: For S3 server access logging, which permission is required on the target bucket?
choices: s3:PutObject for the S3 log delivery group
correctAnswer: s3:PutObject for the S3 log delivery group

name: q50
title: Which condition key restricts access based on the time of day?

name: q51
title: What is required for cross-account S3 bucket replication setup?
choices: IAM role with replication permissions and trust relationship with S3
correctAnswer: IAM role with replication permissions and trust relationship with S3

name: q52
title: Which SQS action allows purging all messages from a queue?

name: q53
title: What is the purpose of the 'aws:SourceAccount' condition key?
choices: To restrict access to requests from specific AWS accounts
To identify the account making the request
correctAnswer: To restrict access to requests from specific AWS accounts

name: q54
title: For S3 cross-region replication, which condition must be met?
choices: Source bucket must have versioning enabled
Both buckets must be in the same region
Both buckets must have public access
correctAnswer: Source bucket must have versioning enabled

name: q55
title: Which policy variable contains the AWS account ID of the principal making the request?

name: q56
title: What is the maximum number of inline policies that can be attached to an IAM role?

name: q57
title: For SQS message encryption, which condition key enforces encryption in transit?

name: q58
title: What happens when a policy has no explicit Allow or Deny statement?

name: q59
title: Which S3 permission allows setting object ACLs during upload?

name: q60
title: For cross-account SQS access with KMS encryption, what additional permission is needed?
choices: kms:Decrypt and kms:GenerateDataKey on the KMS key
correctAnswer: kms:Decrypt and kms:GenerateDataKey on the KMS key
